UpperArmsLVInclineTricepsExtension.name: Lever Incline Triceps Extension
UpperArmsLVInclineTricepsExtension.preparation: Sit on seat and lie back on back support. Push foot lever down with foot and grasp lever handles from behind. With lever handles behind head, place both feet on support or floor.
UpperArmsLVInclineTricepsExtension.execution: Push lever handles up over head until arms are fully extended. Return and repeat.
UpperArmsLVInclineTricepsExtension.comments: When finished, push foot lever down, release handles, then release foot lever.

UpperArmsLVTricepsExtensionOH.name: Lever Overhead Triceps Extension
UpperArmsLVTricepsExtensionOH.preparation: Sit on seat. Push foot lever down with foot and grasp lever handles from behind. With lever handles behind neck, place both feet on support or floor.
UpperArmsLVTricepsExtensionOH.execution: Push lever handles up over head until arms are fully extended. Return and repeat.
UpperArmsLVTricepsExtensionOH.comments: When finished, push foot lever down, release handles, then release foot lever.

UpperArmsLVPushdown.name: Lever Pushdown
UpperArmsLVPushdown.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles by shoulders. Position elbows to sides.
UpperArmsLVPushdown.execution: Push lever down beyond hips until arm is fully extended. Return and repeat.
UpperArmsLVPushdown.comments: Also see movement performed on alternative machine.
UpperArmsLVPushdown.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, wristflexors, pectoralissternal, wristextensors, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor

UpperArmsLVSeatedCloseGripPress.name: Lever Seated Close Grip Press
UpperArmsLVSeatedCloseGripPress.preparation: Sit on seat with chest at height of handles. Grasp handles with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip, just against sides of chest elbows somewhat down to sides.
UpperArmsLVSeatedCloseGripPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Return weight until forearm is against upper arm. Repeat.
UpperArmsLVSeatedCloseGripPress.comments: If lever arms freely move together or apart, keep moderately close grip throughout movement. Triceps will not be as involved in movement if grip is lower than chest. Seat height should be adjusted so bar is at least lower chest height. Also Lever Parallel Grip Bench Press for chest.

UpperArmsLVCloseGripInclineBenchPress.name: Lever Close Grip Incline Bench Press
UpperArmsLVCloseGripInclineBenchPress.preparation: Lie on incline bench with parallel lever bars close to sides of chest. Grasp handles with shoulder width grip.
UpperArmsLVCloseGripInclineBenchPress.execution: Press lever until arms are ext ended. Return weight until wrists are at side of chest. Repeat.
UpperArmsLVCloseGripInclineBenchPress.comments: Also Lever Parallel Grip Incline Bench Press for upper chest.

UpperArmsLVTriDip.name: Lever Triceps Dip
UpperArmsLVTriDip.preparation: If possible, place handles in narrow position. Sit on seat with back against pad. Grasp handles and position elbows back.
UpperArmsLVTriDip.execution: Push levers down by straightening arms downward. Allow lever bar to raise with elbows pointing back until shoulders are slightly stretched. Repeat.
UpperArmsLVTriDip.comments: See Lever Chest Dip with overhand grip and on machine facing fulcrum. Also see Lever Chest Dip.
UpperArmsLVTriDip.synergists: latissimusdorsi, pectoralisminor, pectoralisclavicular, deltoidanterior, levatorscapulae, pectoralissternal, rhomboids

UpperArmsLVTriDip2.name: Lever Triceps Dip
UpperArmsLVTriDip2.preparation: If possible, place handles in narrow position. Sit on seat with legs under pads. Grasp handles and position elbows back.
UpperArmsLVTriDip2.execution: Push levers down by straightening arms downward. Allow lever bar to raise with elbows pointing back until shoulders are slightly stretched. Repeat.
UpperArmsLVTriDip2.comments: See exercise on alternative machine. Also see Lever Chest Dip on machine facing away from fulcrum and Lever Chest Dip.
UpperArmsLVTriDip2.synergists: latissimusdorsi, pectoralisminor, pectoralisclavicular, deltoidanterior, levatorscapulae, pectoralissternal, rhomboids

UpperArmsLVOverhandTriDip.name: Lever Overhand Triceps Dip
UpperArmsLVOverhandTriDip.preparation: Sit on seat with back against pad. Gra sp end of handles with overhand grip and position elbows back.
UpperArmsLVOverhandTriDip.execution: Push levers down by straightening arms downward. Allow lever bar to raise with elbows pointing back until shoulders are slightly stretched. Repeat.
UpperArmsLVOverhandTriDip.comments: Also see parallel grip Lever Triceps Dip and Lever Chest Dip.
UpperArmsLVOverhandTriDip.synergists: latissimusdorsi, pectoralisminor, pectoralisclavicular, deltoidanterior, levatorscapulae, pectoralissternal, rhomboids

UpperArmsLVTriExt.name: Lever Triceps Extension
UpperArmsLVTriExt.preparation: Sit on seat. Grasp handles and place back of upper arms parallel on padding with elbows approximately in line with levers fulcrum.
UpperArmsLVTriExt.execution: Push lever down until arms are fully extended. Return until forearms contact upper arms. Repeat.
UpperArmsLVTriExt.comments: With heavy resistance, back pad will need to be adjusted to keep torso close to arm pad. Adjust seat height, so back of upper arms rest on padding. If seat is too high, shoulder will need to rise near end of extension to complete final range of motion since forearms will make contact with pad before lockout. If seat is too low, range of motion will be compromised because elbows will not be completely flexed at beginning of movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), elbows do not have to be exactly aligned with primary fulcrum. Also see Lever Triceps Extension on alternative apparatus.
UpperArmsLVTriExt.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, wristflexors, pectoralissternal, wristextensors, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor

UpperArmsLVTriExt2.name: Lever Triceps Extension
UpperArmsLVTriExt2.preparation: Sit on seat with arm pads apart to sides. Slide arm pads closer together to sides of the chest. Grasp handles and places back of upper arms on padding.
UpperArmsLVTriExt2.execution: Push the lever down until arms are fully extended. Return until forearms contact upper arms. Repeat.
UpperArmsLVTriExt2.comments: To position elbows higher than the shoulder, position seat lower. To position elbows lower than shoulders, position seat higher. Also, see Lever Triceps Extension on alternative apparatus.
UpperArmsLVTriExt2.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, wristflexors, pectoralissternal, wristextensors, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor

UpperArmsLVAltTriExt.name: Lever Alternating Triceps Extension
UpperArmsLVAltTriExt.preparation: Sit on seat. Grasp handles and place back of upper arms on padding.
UpperArmsLVAltTriExt.execution: Push one lever out and down until arm is fully extended. Return until forearm contacts upper arm. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue alternating movement between arms.
UpperArmsLVAltTriExt.comments: If machine has secondary lever (as shown), elbows do not have to be exactly aligned with primary fulcrum.
UpperArmsLVAltTriExt.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, wristflexors, pectoralissternal, wristextensors, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, trapeziuslower, pectoralisminor
